cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then forecast to accelerate toward the north-northeast and northeast, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Monday evening and then racing offshore of the U.S. Southeast coast toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachicola / Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch north of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeastern Georgia, coastal South and North Carolina, then over the western Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Wednesday with gusts generally below 35 mph
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain (generally <1 inch) possible Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along ocean-facing beaches
